Class Player

java.lang.Object
game.Player
public class Player extends Object
The Player class represents a chess player.

Responsibilities:

  • Store player information (name and color)
  • Track the list of pieces currently controlled by the player
  • Allow adding and removing pieces when captured or placed

This class does not contain logic for moves â€” only state management.

    • Player

      public Player(String name, Color color)
      Constructs a Player with the specified name and color.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the player
      color - the color (WHITE or BLACK) this player controls

    • getAvailablePieces

      public List<Piece> getAvailablePieces()
      Returns the list of pieces currently owned by this player.
      Returns:
      list of pieces on the board for this player

    • addPiece

      public void addPiece(Piece piece)
      Adds a piece to the player's collection.

      This should be called when the board initializes or a piece is promoted.

      Parameters:
      piece - the piece to add

    • removePiece

      public void removePiece(Piece piece)
      Removes a piece from the player's collection.

      This should be called when the piece is captured.

      Parameters:
      piece - the piece to remove

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a formatted string containing the player's name and color.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      string in the format "Name (Color)"
